Title: Object: Les Memorables Journées des François
Description: 11 etchings by Nicolas Cochin representing battles and military victories of French kings and queens, from "Les Memorables Journées des François, ou sont descrites leurs grandes Batailles, & leurs signalées Victoires. Dediées a Monseigneur Le Prince par R. P. Antoine Girard, de la Compagnie de Jesus. Et enrichies de plusiers Figures en Taille-douce" (Paris, Jean Henault) 1647, assembled into an album by François Fossard with pasted letterpress titles from the book. Etchings
Dimensions: Height: 160 millimetres (approx. size of each print)
Height: 535 millimetres (sheet size of each album page)
Curator's comments: For the other works assembled by Fossard into this album, see 1947,0319.8 to 26; 1947,0319.8.25; 1947,0319.8.27 to 49; and 1947,0319.8.1 to 12.
Associated names: Representation of: Fredegund, Queen of the Franks
Representation of: Childebert II, King of Austrasia
Representation of: Lothair I, Emperor and King of Lotharingia and Italy
Representation of: Pepin II, King of Aquitaine
Representation of: Louis the German, King of Eastern Francia
Representation of: Charles II the Bald, King of France
Representation of: Philippe II (Philippe Auguste), King of France
Representation of: Otto IV, Holy Roman Emperor and Duke of Brunswick
Representation of: John, King of England
Representation of: Ferdinand, Count of Flanders
Representation of: St Louis, King Louis IX of France
Representation of: Charles I of Anjou, King of Naples and Sicily
Representation of: Philippe IV, King of France
Representation of: Gui de Dampierre, Count of Flanders
Representation of: Philippe VI, King of France
Representation of: St Joan of Arc
Representation of: Charles VIII the Affable, King of France
Associated events: Associated Event: Battle of Al Mansurah 1250 (1249) (date in brackets is that given in the letterpress)
